title: After the earthquake in Afghanistan, humanitarian aid faces issues
description: On Saturday, October 7, an earthquake struck an area in the west of the country, 35 kilometers from the city of Herat. It was one of the worst to hit the country in decades.

title: Benyamin Netanyahu, an Israeli prime minister at war despite himself
description: The leader least inclined to engage in large-scale conflict in Israel's history has been cornered by the Hamas attack, and now a ground invasion of Gaza is being considered.

title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to run for president as an independent
description: Kennedy, who had run as a Democrat but also built close relationships with far-right and anti-vaccine figures, had accused the DNC of "rigging" the party’s primary against him.

title: Paris 2024 Paralympic Games: Everything you need to know about ticketing
description: On Monday, October 9, 2.8 million tickets for all events have gone on sale without a draw.

title: Hamas attack puts rapprochement between Israel and Saudi Arabia to the test
description: As Hamas revives calls for a 'united front' against Israel, the normalizing of relations between Tel Aviv and Riyadh is called into question.

title: Israeli opposition ready to join war government
description: Benny Gantz, Yaïr Lapid and Avigdor Lieberman declared themselves open to a national coalition for the duration of the fighting. The citizens' movements that have been opposing the justice reform since January have also put an end to their demonstrations.

title: Palestinians in Gaza fear the worst as Israeli bombs fall
description: Strikes by the Israel Defense Forces on the Palestinian enclave have killed more than 450 people, including entire families, but residents fear the worst is still to come.

title: 'We want our children back': Despair for families of Israelis taken hostage by Hamas
description: More than 100 people were captured by Palestinian militants and taken to the Gaza Strip, where their presence complicates the Israeli bombardment of the enclave.

title: Hamas assault on Israel: What we know so far
description: Over 1,100 dead and 100 hostages, escalating Hamas and Israeli military operations and international reactions: Here's what we know on Monday, October 9.

title: Hamas attack in Israel: Rave near Gaza turns into a nightmare
description: Hundreds of young people, gathered near Kibbutz Re'im, less than 6 kilometers from the Gaza border, were still dancing and celebrating at dawn when Hamas militant fighters appeared.

title: Germany's far-right AfD party makes gains, in major setback for Olaf Scholz's SDP
description: In Bavaria and Hesse, the AfD confirmed its surge in the electorate to the detriment of the chancellor's coalition. However, the far-right candidate in the second round of local elections in Bitterfeld-Wolfen (Saxony-Anhalt) lost to the incumbent conservative mayor.

title: Kenya's Kiptum smashes world record at Chicago marathon
description: The 23-year-old shaved 34 seconds off the old record, to cross the line in two hours, 35 seconds.

title: Rugby World Cup: French captain Dupont cleared to resume full training
description: The iconic scrum-half got the green light to return to full-contact training just over a fortnight after his cheekbone was fractured in a tackle against Namibia.

title: The day Hamas radically changed the course of the Israel-Palestine conflict
description: Launching the deadliest attack to hit Israeli territory, killing and kidnapping civilians and soldiers alike, the Palestinian group changed the balance of power on the ground.

title: Israel defense minister orders 'complete siege' on Gaza Strip
description: Yoav Gallant ordered all water, food, electricity and gas to be blocked in this small enclave overcrowded with 2.3 million people.

title: Nobel Prize in Economics awarded to Claudia Goldin for research on women’s labor market outcomes
description: The Harvard professor is only the third woman to ever win the economics prize.

title: Hamas attack on Israel: One map to understand the situation on the ground
description: In the aftermath of the lightning offensive carried out from Gaza by the Palestinian militant group, the Israeli army continues to carry out operations in the south of the country.

title: In Marseille, the last metro is calling it an early night
description: Starting October 23 – and for the next two years – the two metro lines in the French city will stop running at 9:30 p.m. on weekdays in order to test automated trains. The decision is provoking an outcry from both city hall and users.

title: Why Hamas has decided to break the status quo and defy Israel
description: For the first time since the establishment of the Hebrew state in 1948, Palestinian commandos have attacked Israeli towns.

title: Wagner after Wagner: The Kremlin takes charge of reorganizing Russian mercenaries
description: Since Yevgeny Prigozhin's death, various paramilitary groups have been vying to take over the activities of the militia that has become famous around the world. Vladimir Putin appointed one of his leaders, Andrei Trochev, to organize the succession.

title: Two vaccines could be strong contenders in the fight against malaria in Africa
description: The World Health Organization officially recommended the use of a second malaria vaccine to curb the life-threatening disease spread to humans by some mosquitoes – anticipating record demand from African countries.

title: Narges Mohammadi, Nobel Prize in Courage
description: The imprisoned Iranian activist was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her fight for women's rights.

title: Hamas attack on Israel: Emergency UN Security Council meeting takes no immediate action
description: The United Nations Security Council was called for by Malta’s UN ambassador on Sunday, October 8, following the Israel-Palestine conflict's worst escalation in decades.
